verses.verse: There is <WH3426> an evil <WH7451> which <WH834> I have seen <WH7200> under <WH8478> the sun, <WH8121> and it <WH1931> is common <WH7227> among <WH5921> men: <WH120>

A man <WH376> to whom <WH834> God <WH430> hath given <WH5414> riches, <WH6239> wealth, <WH5233> and honor, <WH3519> so that he wanteth <WH2638> nothing <WH369> for his soul <WH5315> of all <WH4480> <WH3605> that <WH834> he desireth, <WH183> yet God <WH430> giveth him not power <WH7980> <WH3808> to eat <WH398> thereof, <WH4480> but <WH3588> a stranger <WH376> <WH5237> eateth <WH398> it: this <WH2088> is vanity, <WH1892> and it <WH1931> is an evil <WH7451> disease. <WH2483>

If <WH518> a man <WH376> beget <WH3205> a hundred <WH3967> children, and live <WH2421> many <WH7227> years, <WH8141> so that the days <WH3117> of his years <WH8141> be <WH7945> <WH1961> many, <WH7227> and his soul <WH5315> be not <WH3808> filled <WH7646> with <WH4480> good, <WH2896> and also <WH1571> that he have <WH1961> no <WH3808> burial; <WH6900> I say, <WH559> that an untimely birth <WH5309> is better <WH2896> than <WH4480> he.
For <WH3588> he cometh <WH935> in with vanity, <WH1892> and departeth <WH1980> in darkness, <WH2822> and his name <WH8034> shall be covered <WH3680> with darkness. <WH2822>
Moreover <WH1571> he hath not <WH3808> seen <WH7200> the sun, <WH8121> nor <WH3808> known <WH3045> any thing: this <WH2088> hath more rest <WH5183> than the other. <WH4480> <WH2088>

Yea, <WH432> though he live <WH2421> a thousand <WH505> years <WH8141> twice <WH6471> told, yet hath he seen <WH7200> no <WH3808> good: <WH2896> do not <WH3808> all <WH3605> go <WH1980> to <WH413> one <WH259> place? <WH4725>
All <WH3605> the labor <WH5999> of man <WH120> is for his mouth, <WH6310> and yet <WH1571> the appetite <WH5315> is not <WH3808> filled. <WH4390>

For <WH3588> what <WH4100> hath the wise <WH2450> more <WH3148> than <WH4480> the fool? <WH3684> what <WH4100> hath the poor, <WH6041> that knoweth <WH3045> to walk <WH1980> before <WH5048> the living? <WH2416>

Better <WH2896> is the sight <WH4758> of the eyes <WH5869> than the wandering <WH4480> <WH1980> of the desire: <WH5315> this <WH2088> is also <WH1571> vanity <WH1892> and vexation <WH7469> of spirit. <WH7307>

That <WH4100> which hath been <WH7945> <WH1961> is named <WH7121> <WH8034> already, <WH3528> and it is known <WH3045> that <WH834> it <WH1931> is man: <WH120> neither <WH3808> may <WH3201> he contend <WH1777> with <WH5973> him that is mightier <WH7945> <WH8623> than <WH4480> he.
Seeing <WH3588> there be <WH3426> many <WH7235> things <WH1697> that increase <WH7235> vanity, <WH1892> what <WH4100> is man <WH120> the better? <WH3148>

For <WH3588> who <WH4310> knoweth <WH3045> what <WH4100> is good <WH2896> for man <WH120> in this life, <WH2416> all <WH4557> the days <WH3117> of his vain <WH1892> life <WH2416> which he spendeth <WH6213> as a shadow? <WH6738> for <WH834> who <WH4310> can tell <WH5046> a man <WH120> what <WH4100> shall be <WH1961> after <WH310> him under <WH8478> the sun? <WH8121>
